channel.title: Varrock Fountain?
channel.description:
My varrock fountain has aload of crap around it. It looks really unattractive.
How do i fix this? I dont want a new client etc.
[IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/o9ntwl.png[/img]

item.title: Varrock Fountain?
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

[quote=“Spades, post:7, topic:412142”][quote author=alexc95 link=topic=513393.msg3728145#msg3728145 date=1314436058]
There is no such thing as a ‘Perfect’ client Technovirus3, every client needs some kind of work to make it playable.
[/quote]

I beg to differ, I just downloaded a 317 deob and made it compatible with my server, then I started adding things like HeadIcons to load through the cache. I don’t have any models folders, sprites folders, or anything. My Client runs everything off the cache. I don’t even have customs because those just ruin the game IMO.[/quote]
Exactly.

Read full topic

item.title: Varrock Fountain?
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

alexc95:

There is no such thing as a ‘Perfect’ client Technovirus3, every client needs some kind of work to make it playable.

I beg to differ, I just downloaded a 317 deob and made it compatible with my server, then I started adding things like HeadIcons to load through the cache. I don’t have any models folders, sprites folders, or anything. My Client runs everything off the cache. I don’t even have customs because those just ruin the game IMO.

item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

You guys are dumb, this has nothing to do with the server, these are custom models packed in the cache, because some guy(Not saying who, not you Technovirus) had to fuck this client up. I suggest using another client.

item.title: Varrock Fountain?
item.dc:creator: @I_Roll_Deep I Roll Deep
item.description:
@I_Roll_Deep wrote:

check out the objects coord, look for ur makeglobalobjact/createobject void and remove the objects you want to get rid off

Read full topic

item.title: Varrock Fountain?
item.dc:creator: @alexc95 alexc95
item.description:
@alexc95 wrote:

Looks like those are Global Objects.

If you’re using delta look in your Client.java in your server source. Search for the line “makeGlobalObject”, then look for a integer within those that is used repetitively, this is most likely your cause.

If you need any more help, or get any more problems, add me on skype :

alexcalexc84

Read full topic
